title: Gallery Sign Font
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317100337im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Letham-Gallery_6558.jpg)

Hi, does anyone know what font or similar has been used to create this sign?

Thanks

Font: 

 (sign lettering) 

Solved By: 

 [donshottype](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317100337/http:/typophile.com/user/205259 "View user profile.")

author: leon.cayford@or...

comments.content:
I suspect this is sign lettering in a style sometimes called flareserif rather than a specific font.  
For similar fonts take a look at [Flange BQ](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317100337/http:/www.identifont.com/list?3+Flange%20BQ+0+HCJ+1+HF9+2+K2+2+GIA+2+EPZ+2+4CZ+2+CAX+2+3DV+2+CMN+2+41C+2+43T+2+EJ+2+26V+2+8GG+4+1W81+4+2VA+4+HE5+4+5GU+4+6CF+4+6DH+4+LX+4+N1U+5+OX3+5+32I+5+U5+5+226+5+F8+5+23M+5+22VP+5+GUO+5) and similar fonts in the link.

I concur with Don it is most probably a hand-painted lettering for signage and not a font. Some more alternatives now: [Symbol ITC](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317100337/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/itc/symbol), [Triplett](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317100337/http:/www.fonts.com/font/monotype-imaging/triplett), [Elan ITC](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317100337/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/itc/elan), [Memo](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317100337/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/mti/memo), [Hensler 2](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317100337/http:/www.letterheadfonts.com/fonts/hensler2.php), [Modesto](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317100337/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/parkinson/modesto)
